intro: Orthocarpus purpurascens var. venustus, commonly known as the showy orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest in horticultural studies.
